oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Experimental revalidation of certain durability design provisions for concrete with reference to the Indian code of practice
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DAS, BB
SINGH, DN
PANDEY, SP
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The design parameters for durability of concrete in various codes of practices include minimum cement content, maximum water-cement ratio and minimum cover thickness corresponding to various environmental exposure conditions. A study was undertaken to revalidate the provisions made for the first two of the three design parameters mentioned above in the Indian Code of practice. The findings are expected to be of wider applicability as the patterns of provision are similar in different codes of practices. The present study also attempts to check if some of the codal provisions made on the basis of Ordinary Portland Cement-based concrete are extendable to Portland Pozzolana Cement - based concrete as well.
